intro: Streptanthus petiolaris, commonly known as the slenderleaf whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other mustard plants. This species is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a slight pubescence, and it is often found in coastal regions.
